body_content.explanation: an arrangement in which two or more things are positioned in a straight line or parallel to each other:
examples: This mattress supports the body in a way that keeps the neck and spine in alignment.
Try to keep your head in alignment with your spine.
The problem is happening because the wheels are out of alignment.

body_content.explanation: an agreement between a group of countries, political parties, or people who want to work together because of shared interests or aims:
examples: New alignments are being formed within the business community.

body_content.explanation: If two things or people are in alignment, they are the same as or similar to each other, or agree with each other. If they are out of alignment, they are different, or disagree:
examples: At the moment, it seems to me that we're in alignment.
The feedback was in alignment with my own experience.
On reflection, I think my priorities were out of alignment.
Many families are living in communities where home prices are way out of alignment with incomes.
